text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
(1) IRM 4.75.17.1.6: Updated the EO/FSL cases subject to Mandatory Review per Interim Guidance on Cases Subject to Mandatory Review, TEGE-04-0817-0027, dated September 1, 2017.
ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

This supersedes IRM 4.75.17, Exempt Organizations Examination Procedures, EO Examinations Review Responsibilities and Procedures, dated June 8, 2017. This revision incorporates Interim Guidance Memorandum TEGE-04-0817-0027, Interim Guidance on cases subject to Mandatory Review, dated July 15, 2019

Review

) Purpose: This manual focuses on the unit in EO, FSL/ET area (pursuant to TEGE reorganization), responsible for reviewing the ﬁeld agents cases and and providing technical services to the ﬁeld. Topics addressed include: a. Unagreed cases without protest b. Preparation and issuance of

-day letters (including statutory deﬁciency) c. Closing agreements, including Classiﬁcation Settlement Program and walk in requests d. Technical advice or assistance requests e. Publishing activities (such as the IRM) f. Providing coordinators on various issues (
) Audience: The procedures in this manual apply to EO including FSL/ET nation employees in the following series: • GS-
• GS-
• GS-
• GS-
) Policy Owner: EO Director (
) Program Owner: EO (

) Ensuring technical accuracy for the agent’s ﬁeld audits is essential for the mission assigned to EO. Producing an accurate work product includes: a. Technical positions are well thought out. b. The facts are properly developed. c. Audit conclusions are fully supported. d. The case follows current procedures and legislation. e. The case ﬁle is complete and in proper order. (
) Policy Statement
says the primary objective of the EO audit program regulatory, with emphasis on continued qualiﬁcation of exempt IRM
) IRC

gives agents the authority to: a. Examine any books, papers, records or other data necessary to an audit. b. Take testimony under oath to secure additional information needed. c. Issue a summons for information necessary to complete an audit. d. Inquire into any offense connected with the administration or of the internal revenue laws. (
) Reviewers are familiar with and act in accordance with taxpayer rights. IRC
) After the audit, the reviewers are responsible to determine if: (

Exempt Organizations Examination Procedures
Agents should consult the K-Net Knowledge Management Network to ensure proper issue development and consistent application of the law.
The table lists commonly used acronyms and

ACRONYM DEFINITION AIMS Audit Information Management System EO Exempt Organizations FSL/ET Federal, State and Local Governments/Employment Tax Area K-NET Knowledge Management Network SME Subject Matter Expert RAR Revenue Agent Report RCCMS Reporting Compliance Case Man- agement System TAM Technical Advice Memorandum TE/GE Tax Exempt/Government Entities

Mandatory Review provides technical guidance for examiners in EO, FSL/ET. Generally, Mandatory Review staff conducts: a. Procedural reviews of certain types of cases. b. Develops technical guidance such as IRMs, Alerts, IGMs, etc. c. Performs duties related to closing agreements. Cases subject to Mandatory Review are listed below:
a. Unagreed exam closures without protest to Appeals requiring the issuance of: • A Statutory Notice of Deﬁciency, or • Letter

, Notice of Determination of Worker Classiﬁcation Note: However, all AGREED worker classiﬁcation cases will close directly to the closing unit for immediate assessment. b. Unagreed claim disallowances (full or partial) without protest to requiring the issuance of • Letter
Final Partial Claim Disallowance, or • Letter

, Final Full Claim Disallowance c. All revocations or any other loss of tax-exemption (even if agreed) d. All foundation reclassiﬁcations (even if agreed) e. Management requests (senior manager’s approval required) (
) In addition to management requests (requiring senior managements management may designate any type or group of cases as a
% review category if deemed essential. (

) Mandatory Review performs the ﬁnal review of the case before it closes to EO Closing Unit (formerly Examination Special Support (ESS)), or GE Unit. Mandatory Review also handles requests for: • Closing agreements • Forms
, Examination Suspense Report • Published instructions (IRM and interim guidance memoranda) • EO letter revisions • Redactions of ﬁnal audit reports,
-day letters, and corresponding cover letters • Responding to procedural questions via mailbox *TEGE EO Review Staff • Non-standard unpublished letters assistance (
) Mandatory Review also coordinates: • Closing agreements • Internal Revenue Manuals • Technical advice requests (see IRM
for requesting technical rulings) • Closing letters Note: For a complete list of collateral duties, refer to Exhibit
, below; Table of Collateral duties of Review Staff (

, EO Examination Procedures. SMEs answer questions sent to the *TEGE EO Review Staff mailbox, normally within three business days.
Exempt Organizations Examination Procedures
) The term Examiner in this IRM refers to the individuals assigned to EO nation including FSL/ET cases, regardless of whether the employee is in General Series (GS)
, or
occupational series. (
) Groups closing cases subject to Mandatory Review follow the directions in
, Shipping from the group, and IRM
, Shipping to ally Identiﬁable Information (PII). Review (
) EO employees, including FSL/ET, will send their cases subject to review to: Internal Revenue Service TE/GE Mandatory Review MC:
DAL
Commerce St. Dallas, Texas
) Mandatory Review Statute Coordinator- When you receive a case from a group: a. Acknowledge receipt of Form
, Document Transmittal. b. Return one copy of the Form

to the group. c. Upload it to the Reporting Compliance Case Management System (RCCMS). d. Verify the assessment statute of expirations date (ASED). Notify the Mandatory Review manager if statute procedures (including proper alpha code “PP”) aren’t followed. Note: For cases involving imminent statute returns refer to IRM
e. Hand the case ﬁle to the Mandatory Review manager to assign to a reviewer. Caution: If the case ﬁle lacks Form
or the group didn’t close the Mandatory Review on RCCMS, prepare Form
, forward an e-mail the group. (
) Mandatory Review Statute Coordinator- If the case doesn’t belong in Mandatory Review: a. Prepare a transmittal (Form
). b. Complete Form

, Request for mail/shipping service (if sending case outside of Dallas). c. Double package the ﬁle (if sending the case outside Dallas). d. Transfer the case on RCCMS to the appropriate unit. e. Send the case to appropriate unit. (
) Mandatory Review Statute Coordinator- When you prepare the case to the reviewer: a. Prepare a case closing check-sheet, noting the name and employer tiﬁcation number (EIN). See IRM Exhibit
, Mandatory Review Cover Sheet. b. On the check sheet, indicate the date of case assignment. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
X

c. On the check sheet, list each tax module assigned to the reviewer by master ﬁle type (MFT), tax period, and ASED. d. Research the Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) and generate AMDISA, BMFOLI, BMFOLT, and INOLES prints. e. Include the IDRS prints in the ﬁle or secure e-mail them to the reviewer. f. Get the Mandatory Review manager’s signature on the case closing sheet. g. Place the check sheet on the outside of the case ﬁle folder. h. Transfer the modules in RCCMS to the assigned reviewer’s inventory. i. Prepare Forms
and
j. Double package the ﬁle per the instructions at IRM
k. Put the package into the outgoing mail. (

) Mandatory Review Manager- Upon receipt of the case ﬁle: a. Inspect the case ﬁle. b. Determine the issue(s). c. If the case belongs in Mandatory Review, assign to a reviewer. d. Give the case to a tax examining assistant/clerk indicating to whom where to send it. Note: The Mandatory Review manager assigns cases based on reviewer and doesn’t consider geographical location, unless the closed case comes from a reviewer’s post of duty, in which case they assign it to another reviewer. Reviewers don’t review cases they worked on before joining Mandatory Review. (
) Reviewer, Mandatory Review - When you receive the case ﬁle: a. Sign the Form
b. Prepare a fax cover sheet, attention: tax examining assistant/clerk’s number. c. Fax the cover sheet and Form

to the tax examining e-fax number. d. In MS Outlook, instruct the assistant/clerk to send the signatures to inbox. e. Review the case ﬁle to verify the statute of limitations. f. Document in a new Form
the completion of steps a through e above. (
) The Reviewer performs the actions throughout this subsection. (
) When reviewing the case, focus on technical and procedural accuracy. Review performs quality reviews of closed cases. No need to duplicate by doing a quality review on a Mandatory Review case. (

) Focus on these key areas: • Verify the statute(s) of limitations. • Verify the proper use of alpha code “PP” for consistency. • Collect sufficient facts. • Identify direct applicable law. • Explain the law as applied both clearly and plainly. Internal Revenue Manual

c. On the check sheet, list each tax module assigned to the reviewer by master ﬁle type (MFT), tax period, and ASED. d. Research the Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) and generate AMDISA, BMFOLI, BMFOLT, and INOLES prints. e. Include the IDRS prints in the ﬁle or secure e-mail them to the reviewer. f. Get the Mandatory Review manager’s signature on the case closing sheet. g. Place the check sheet on the outside of the case ﬁle folder. h. Transfer the modules in RCCMS to the assigned reviewer’s inventory. i. Prepare Forms
and

, Memorandum - EP/EO. (

) In preparing the form, determine the type of feedback to provide: a. Advisory: Errors don’t require agent action(s). b. Inquiry: Errors require agent action(s), based on your initial review of case. c. Correction: Errors still require agent action(s), based on your review of a case you previously returned to the group. (

) Advisory memoranda may also be commendatory. You may prepare a com- mendatory advisory memo if you believe the agent has performed exceptionally well on a case. Group managers may place these memos in agent’s employee personnel folder. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

, Memorandum - EP/EO. In preparing the form, determine the type of feedback to provide: a. Advisory: Errors don’t require agent action(s). b. Inquiry: Errors require agent action(s), based on your initial review of case. c. Correction: Errors still require agent action(s), based on your review of a case you previously returned to the group. Advisory memoranda may also be commendatory. You may prepare a mendatory advisory memo if you believe the agent has performed exceptionally well on a case. Group managers may place these memos in agent’s employee personnel folder.

Before determining which memo to prepare, determine whether the error involves an agreed issue. In general, don’t instruct the agent to reopen an agreed issue, or create a new issue, unless your grounds are substantial and/or the potential effect upon the tax liability is material.

) When writing an inquiry or correction memo: a. Use plain language. b. Provide a brief history of why Mandatory Review has the case. c. Outline the errors identiﬁed in the case ﬁle. d. Outline a course of action for the agent to complete. e. Provide corrected computations, if applicable. f. Give directions on how to prepare Form
, Response to Memorandum - EP/EO. g. List your mailing address. Note: Reviewers would reference an attachment on Form
and write all tional comments on a Word ﬁle which can be converted to a PDF ﬁle if necessary.

) For advisory memos, identify the error(s). Show where to ﬁnd directions to avoid the errors in the future. (Cases without errors may merit a commenda- tory advisory memo). (

) The group manager considers the reviewer’s memorandum. The group must submit their reply within
days of receipt. a. If the group manager considers the reviewer’s memorandum inappropri- ate, refer to IRM
, Dispute Resolution. b. Otherwise, forward Form
via secure e-mail to the agent. Return the case to the agent via RCCMS, and maintain appropriate AIMS controls. (
) The agent: Upon receipt of the returned case: a. Reopen the case on Web ETS. b. Flip the Form
over to see if there is a word ﬁle printed on the back.
d. Note the directions provided in the memo. e. Contact the reviewer if you have any questions about the directions. (
) Confer with your manager about the requested actions. If you and your manager disagree with the course of action, proceed to IRM
, Dispute Resolution. Otherwise, perform the actions requested. Caution: If you don’t do the actions requested, you may receive the case back again, with a correction memo attached. (
) If unable to complete the actions requested, ask the reviewer for an course of action. (
) Request and secure a statute extension, if needed. (
) Before you close your case to your manager: a. Fully document your actions taken in your Form
and on Form b. Verify that the hours on your Form
agree with the time input on Web ETS. c. Update and print your Forms
and related workpapers. d. Electronically sign and print the Form
e. Upload the Form
and the other updated documents to RCCMS. f. Reassemble your case ﬁle. See IRM
, Case File Assembly. (
) Close the case ﬁle to your manager. Note: If located in a different post of duty than your manager, prepare a package (Forms
and

) Reply to Mandatory Review within
days of receipt of a reviewer’s memo. (
) FSL/ET groups will alternatively take the appropriate action per Form
’s directions. Accordingly: a. E-mail an information copy of the Form

to the Mandatory Review manager, so he/she will be aware the case has been returned to the Reviewer. b. Close the examination case if the group’s reply to the Mandatory reviewer addresses all issues in a satisfactory way. c. Forward the case to the Mandatory Review manager, for additional guidance and direction if one or more issues remain unresolved. d. FSL/ET groups will also reply to Mandatory Review within
days of receipt of a reviewers memo. Note: FSL/ET may continue to use Form

E-mail an information copy of the Form

to the Mandatory Review manager, so he/she will be aware the case has been returned to the Reviewer. Close the examination case if the group’s reply to the Mandatory reviewer addresses all issues in a satisfactory way. Forward the case to the Mandatory Review manager, for additional guidance and direction if one or more issues remain unresolved. FSL/ET groups will also reply to Mandatory Review within
days of receipt of a reviewers memo.
Note: FSL/ET may continue to use Form 9984 in lieu of EO’s Form 5464 and Form 4318 in lieu of Form 5773.
The group manager has two options for resolving disputes with a reviewer’s recommended course of action:
Exempt Organizations Examination
Contact the reviewer to discuss the case. Document the outcome of discussion in the Form
Have the agent complete any agreed actions. Sign the Form
and return the case to the reviewer.
Complete the Form
documenting the disputed items and why the group won’t take the course of action. Sign the Form
and return case to the reviewer. (
) Reviewer: Upon receipt of the case ﬁle: a. Review the Form
and the case ﬁle. b. Determine whether to agree with the group manager. c. Sign the Form
, checking the applicable entries in boxes
and
) Reviewer: If in disagreement with the group, contact the Mandatory Review Manager. Provide a copy of the Form
Discuss the case. (

) Mandatory Review manager: Schedule a call with the EO or FSL/ET group manager and his/her area manager. Document the discussion and any tion agreed upon by the area manager and the EO or FSL/ET manager. If parties can’t agree upon a course of action, the Director EO Examinations makes the ﬁnal decision on the issue. (
) Mandatory Review manager: Convey the directions to the reviewer, who prepares a correction memorandum to return the case, or proceeds to make any necessary corrections before closing the case. (
) Reviewer: If issuing a correction memorandum, see IRM
, a Memorandum. If correcting any errors and closing the case, see IRM
, Closing a Case. (

) Reviewer: If there aren’t problems regarding the case, prepare it for closure: a. Consider a commendatory memo (If appropriate). b. Complete and sign the closing check sheet. c. Sign and date the Forms
and
d. Upload the

-day letter package and any workpapers you’ve created RCCMS. e. For revocations, send the redaction package to the Mandatory Review senior tax analyst. f. If available as an option, scan and upload the Area Counsel memoran- dum to RCCMS. g. Print your Form
and place it behind the case closing check (
) Reviewer: Prepare the case to ship to Dallas: a. Prepare Forms

) Mandatory Review encourages all EO Examination employees to submit procedural questions to the *TEGE EO Review Staff mailbox. (

) Before you submit a question, review the available materials on the topic, such as: • Internal Revenue Code sections • Treasury Regulations • Applicable court cases • Other legal guidance • Continuing professional education materials • Internal Revenue Manuals • Interim guidance memoranda Internal Revenue Manual

) Please list the resources you researched when submitting your question. (
) The mailbox coordinator either answers or forwards the question to a SME, with an expected response of three business days. SMEs aren’t limited to members of Mandatory Review. (

) When an agent or manager directly contacts a reviewer, whether by Skype, person, or by phone, the reviewer documents the question (such as the conversation from Skype to e-mail) and forwards the question with the viewer’s response to the mailbox. (

) Mandatory Review maintains a table of previously asked questions and responses. The reviewer may access this table to see if a previously answer is available and applies it to the current question. (
